page.title: 01Todmorden-Our Town
page.content: Todmorden is a small, Pennine town in West Yorkshire.A large proportion of its population of 14,500 are elderly. We have alot of old, terraced houses and mills.The mills used to make cotton.Many of them are now empty and derelict, or have changed their use. There is a street full of shops, three supermarkets, and an indoor and outdoor market which is open on Wednesday, Friday and Saturday. Todmorden has a big park with a playground near a football pitch.There are quite a few paths leading to crazy golf, tennis courts, bowling greens, swimming baths, and a cafe.The hills around Todmorden are excellent for walking with the Calderdale and Pennine Ways nearby. The recently restored canal has boat runs in summer.
